definition: Buddhist monk
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
still/yet/to value/to esteem
surname Shang
see 做一天和尚撞一天鐘|做一天和尚撞一天钟[zuo4 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1]
pinyin: dang1 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1

definition: lit. as a monk for today, toll today's bell (idiom)/fig. to do one's job mechanically/to hold a position passively
pinyin: zuo4 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1

definition: lit. like a three-meter high monk, you can't rub his head (idiom)/fig. at a total loss
pinyin: zhang4 er4 he2 shang5 , mo1 bu5 zhao2 tou2 nao3

definition: see 三個和尚沒水喝|三个和尚没水喝[san1 ge4 he2 shang5 mei2 shui3 he1]
pinyin: san1 ge4 he2 shang5 mei2 shui3 chi1

definition: lit. three monks have no water to drink (idiom)/fig. everybody's business is nobody's business/(If there is one monk, he will fetch water for himself. If there are two, they will fetch water together. But if there are three or more, none will take it upon himself to fetch water.)
pinyin: san1 ge4 he2 shang5 mei2 shui3 he1

definition: see 和尚打傘，無法無天|和尚打伞，无法无天[he2 shang5 da3 san3 , wu2 fa3 wu2 tian1]
lit. like a monk holding an umbrella — no hair, no sky (idiom) (punning on 髮|发[fa4] vs 法[fa3])/fig. defying the law and the principles of heaven/lawless
pinyin: he2 shang5 da3 san3 , wu2 fa3 wu2 tian1

definition: lit. in the presence of a monk, insult another monk, calling him a bald-headed bandit (idiom)/fig. to insult indirectly/to criticize obliquely
pinyin: dui4 zhe5 he2 shang5 ma4 zei2 tu1

definition: lit. to insult a bald man while pointing at a monk (idiom)/fig. to insult indirectly/to criticize obliquely
pinyin: zhi3 zhe5 he2 shang5 ma4 tu1 zi5

definition: Sha Wujing

the monk can run away, but the temple won't run with him (idiom)/you can run this time, but you'll have to come back/I'll get you sooner or later/also written 跑得了和尚，跑不了廟|跑得了和尚，跑不了庙[pao3 de2 liao3 he2 shang4 , pao3 bu4 liao3 miao4]
pinyin: pao3 le5 he2 shang4 pao3 bu4 liao3 miao4

definition: the monk can run away, but the temple won't run with him (idiom)/you can run this time, but you'll have to come back/I'll get you sooner or later
pinyin: pao3 le5 he2 shang4 , pao3 bu4 liao3 si4

definition: the monk can run away, but the temple won't run with him (idiom)/you can run this time, but you'll have to come back/I'll get you sooner or later
pinyin: pao3 de2 liao3 he2 shang4 , pao3 bu4 liao3 miao4

definition: the monk coming from afar is good at reading scriptures (idiom)/foreign talent is valued higher than local talent
pinyin: yuan3 lai2 de5 he2 shang5 hui4 nian4 jing1

definition: Jianzhen or Ganjin (688-763), Tang Buddhist monk, who crossed to Japan after several unsuccessful attempts, influential in Japanese Buddhism

sentences.chinese: 一首關於虛雲老和尚的歌曲。

sentences.english: The next morning, he asks the monks what the sound was, but they say, "We can't tell you."
sentences.chinese: 第二天一大早，男子就問和尚，那聲音是啥呀。

sentences.english: Among them, there is often a young man listening to the old monk sitting under a tree view.
sentences.chinese: 其中，有一位年輕人也常坐在樹下聽老和尚說法。

sentences.english: Last year, the party celebrated at its office in Moulmein, only offering food to monks.
sentences.chinese: 去年，僅在毛淡棉的辦公室慶祝，只提供奉獻給和尚。

sentences.english: That the voice is greatly some, ask for to come to the monk's upset attention in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 那聲音有些大，惹來了廟裏和尚的不悅的注目。

sentences.english: The monk can run away, but he can run with the temple.
sentences.chinese: 要不然跑得了和尚，跑不了廟啊。

sentences.english: A little monk who is not old enough to get ordained is called a 'sami. '
sentences.chinese: 小和尚還不到受戒年齡，就叫做“沙彌”。

sentences.english: The little bonzer became the master's inheritor later.
sentences.chinese: 後來，這位小和尚成了師傅的衣鉢傳人。

sentences.english: He has died to worldly matters and become a Buddhist monk.
sentences.chinese: 他已看破紅塵，出家當和尚了。

sentences.english: Spirit should be the temple, wisdom to release the monks side by hand touching the edge repair figure of Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 靈應寺內，智釋和尚正在邊用手觸摸邊修補佛像。

sentences.english: It is her uncle, the Bonze, who has found out about her conversion.
sentences.chinese: 原來是她當和尚的叔叔，發現了她叛教的事。

sentences.english: Although the monk chased after it, it was still too late.
sentences.chinese: 雖然和尚立刻追了過去，不過還是遲了一步。

sentences.english: They asked, ‘why did you have to show the monk like that?
sentences.chinese: 他們問，‘你爲什麼要這樣演示一個和尚？

sentences.english: The little monk danced and clapped with happiness.
Often he slept in Buddhist temples where monks gave him food and shelter for the night.
sentences.chinese: 芭蕉常常睡在寺廟，寺裏的和尚給他提供食宿。

sentences.english: The Kungfu monks of China, testing physical extremes with rods of iron.
sentences.chinese: 中國的功夫和尚正在用鐵棒測試身體的極限。

definition: monk
Daoist priest
a senior monk
monk/nun (Buddhist or Daoist)
Buddhist nun
monk/Sangha, the Buddhist monastic order
one of three fabled islands in Eastern sea, abode of immortals
square zhang (i.e. unit of area 10 feet square)/monastic room 10 feet square/Buddhist or Daoist abbot/abbot's chamber
novice Buddhist monk
(derog.) Buddhist monk
lama, spiritual teacher in Tibetan Buddhism
itinerant monk (loanword from Sanskrit)
name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)
Buddha/founder of a buddhist sect
to administer a monastery Buddhist or Daoist/abbot/head monk
to return to normal life (leaving a monastic order)
poor monk (humble term used by monk of himself)
